intro: Chrysanthemum carnosum, commonly known as the woolly chrysanthemum, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its dense, hairy foliage and showy yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and drought tolerance. Chrysanthemum carnosum is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
